template:
column field description
1 location country / state
2 cases/day/million average number of confirmed cases per day (over the last 7 days) per million persons.
we have taken an average over the last 7 days to filter out any weekend effects.
3 RN (Repr. Nr) Reproduction number which is defined as
(conf_cases_last_week / conf_cases_week_before)
where conf_cases_last_week is the total number of new confirmed cases registered last week. A week is chosen to filter out any weekend effects.
4 RN (-1 day) same as previous column but then calculated for the previous day. So tomorrow this column shows the same value you can see today in previous column.
5 RN (-1week) same as 3rd column but then calculated for the previous week. So a week later this column will show the same value as you can see today in 3rd column.
6 RN (-2week) same as 3rd column but then calculated for 2 weeks ago. So 2 weeks later this column will show the same value as you can see today in 3rd column.
7 RN (-3week) same as 3rd column but then calculated for 3 weeks ago.
8 tot. cases/million total confirmed cases (at date retrieved) per million. So this includes all confirmed cases.
9 popul. [million] total country population expressed in million.
10 tot. cases total reported confirmed cases.

rules.to:
( /* 3 color gradient green (0,255,0) - yellow (255, 255, 0) - red (255,0,0)*/ $rep_nr_with_style_fn := function($rep_nr){ "
" & $rep_nr & "
" }; payload ~> | $ | { "html_reproduction_number" : $rep_nr_with_style_fn(reproduction_number), "html_reproduction_number_1day_ago" : $rep_nr_with_style_fn(reproduction_number_1day_ago), "html_reproduction_number_1week_ago" : $rep_nr_with_style_fn(reproduction_number_1week_ago), "html_reproduction_number_2week_ago" : $rep_nr_with_style_fn(reproduction_number_2week_ago), "html_reproduction_number_3week_ago" : $rep_nr_with_style_fn(reproduction_number_3week_ago) } | )
